wikipedia_page.main: Howard Plumb (28 August 1971 – 7 July 2014) was a British windsurfer. He competed in the Mistral One Design at the 1996 Summer Olympics.On 5 July 2014, Plumb sustained head injuries after colliding with a car whilst he was cycling in Knight's Hill, Charlton. Plumb was airlifted to London's St George's Hospital however he later died on 7 July 2014 as the result of the injuries sustained. The driver of the car which struck Plumb later pled guilty to a charge of causing death by careless driving.

response: *Howard Plumb, 42, British Olympic windsurfer (1996), injuries sustained in a traffic collision.Tributes to former Westbourne Olympian
